properties.areaDesc: Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin; Lander Foothills
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 2 at 3:41PM MST until February 4 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...Major Winter Storm is expected through Monday Night...

.A cold front move southward through Wyoming into tonight. The
snow is expected to spread from the north this afternoon and
spread south tonight. This storm system will impact most areas
through Monday evening, then taper off late Monday night. The
heaviest snowfall looks to occur tonight through Monday morning.

* WHAT...Moderate to Heavy snow.

* WHERE...Wind River Mountains West, Wind River Mountains East,
Wind River Basin, Lander Foothills and Green Mountains and
Rattlesnake Range.

* WHEN...From 8 PM Sunday to 5 AM MST Tuesday. The heaviest snow
is expected late tonight into Monday morning.

* SNOW AMOUNTS...6 to 12 inches in the Wind River Basin.
Snowfall of 12 to 18 inches in the Lander Foothills. Snowfall
of 5 to 8 inches from Crowheart to Dubois.

* SNOW AMOUNTS...16 to 24 inches on the eastern slopes of the
Wind River Mountains with locally higher amounts possible.
Snowfall of 8 to 16 inches on the western slopes.

* IMPACTS...Travel may be very difficult late tonight and Monday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...South Pass will be impacted with a
northeast wind of 25 to 35 mph with higher gusts. Near
blizzard conditions may occur. Areas of blowing and drifting
snow will occur in other areas.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM MST TUESDAY
